message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI 

The paper deals with the problem of computing correspondences between deformable shapes, which is a common problem in computer vision and graphics. The proposed method is based on Bayesian inference, which is a statistical approach commonly used in machine learning and computer vision. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also deals with 3D shape matching, which falls under the sub-category cs.GR (Graphics). The proposed method is based on statistical inference, which is a topic in machine learning and statistics, and therefore the paper could also be classified under cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper deals with point-wise correspondence recovery algorithms, which could also fall under the sub-category cs.MM (Multimedia).
